In three sentences
Comments

The campus is completely safe. We've never had anything bad happen (no robberies,intruders, anything) for at least the 2 years I've been here. no one really even locks their car doors, it's THAT safe.
None.
There are about 8 clubs on campus.

Anyone who wants a small school with little rigor. One-on-one help from professors is very common, with a class size of 10-40 people. If you don't mind having no social life within campus, and want to get a degree cheap, this is the school for you!
There's a center court yard in the middle of Founder's Hall, not many people use it so if it's nice outside, it's a good place for studying or if you're just on a break.
I'd say that for the little you pay to attend here, you are getting an education, maybe not the highest quality, but a degree nonetheless.
Again, joining clubs is about the best you can do without going 30-40 mi away. I'ts a small rural area. A few bowling alleys are close, and a small mall.

There is a cafeteria where they serve a few different items to eat. Most students pack their lunches, or don't eat at the college at all. There is a Hardee's down the road, but thats the only other eating place within a close proximity
It literally doesn't exist; this is a commuter school.
The school is a commuter, community college, where a lot of older people come to finish their degree, or change their life path, so many professors go slow to make sure everyone understands.
The only tip I have is to join clubs; it's literally the only way to meet people with he same basic interests that you have.

Kent State at Tuscarawas is a very small campus, with all age groups attending because everyone commutes. It's a nice school if you're only looking for an education with virtually no social interaction. You won't make many friends, BUT if you need help, most professors are willing to help.

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Food and Dining i dislike the food court. arbys is just down the road. Dorm Life no dorms. Academic Rigor the classes can be tough but so many people are willing to help out and teachers are willing to assist you if you ask. Tips for prospective students it is a really great school, the campus is small and so it is easier to navigate. In three sentences kent state univeristy at tuscarawas is the friendliest little college i have ever attended. the staff and students welcome you with open arms and offer a sense of caring. i am so happy i picked tuscarawas to attend school.
